instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 No Power Orange Light
threads.message:
History!

I got this MacBook in working condition . Just replaced U6100 to eliminate Efi password. It worked fine until I took out the motherboard to get some readings and comparisons in order to fix another exactly the same board that was dead.

Suddenly the working MoBo went dead.



Only yellow light on the charger, no fan spin.



Here are some readings!

PPDCIN_G3H 16.53 v

PP3V42_G3H 3.38v

PPBUS_G3H 8.52 V

PP3V3_S5 3.3V

PP5V_S4RS3 0.0 V

PP3V3_SUS 0.72V

threads.title: 820-00165 No Power Orange Light
threads.message:
Inspect for broken trace, or knocked off components first.

Post PM_BATLOW_L, SMC_ADAPTER_EN, PM_DSW_PWRGD, PCH_DSWVRMEN and the 4 PCH's RTC signals.

threads.title: 820-00165 No Power Orange Light
threads.message:
Good Morning!

PM_BATLOW_L     3.27V
SMC_ADAPTER_EN  3.7V
PM_DSW_PWRGD  3.7V
PCH_DSWVRMEN   2.1 V

I don't know how to read  4 PCH's RTC signals 

I've found this IC chipped underneath I don't know if this is the reason why  PP3V3_SUS is 0.72 V instead of 3.3v.

threads.title: 820-00165 No Power Orange Light
threads.message:
Looks broken, change it.

BTW, read about PCH's RTC signals and more things...
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/how-to-collection.60974/[/URL]
